title: Immigration is topic at travel club meeting
body:
Beth Radtke, vice president of the International Institute, will be the featured speaker at a meeting of the 
International Travel Club, 2 to 4 p.m. next Saturday at the St. Louis County Library, 1640 South Lindbergh 
Boulevard.

Radtke will discuss the impact of more than 8,000 immigrants and newcomers settling in St. Louis this year. Also, 
travel agent Norma Johnson will lead a discussion on riverboat cruising in Europe.

Members of the club and nonmembers are welcome. For more information, call Hal Grady at 314-275-8445.
